Name: Galaxy
Description: A galaxy is a massive, gravitationally bound system that consists of stars and stellar remnants, an interstellar medium of gas and dust, and an possibly the largest component tentatively named as dark matter.

Properties.Name: Apparent mass
Properties.Description: Apparent mass of the galaxy in Solar mass units

Properties.Name: Apparent dimension
Properties.Description: Dimension of the galaxy (in Arc Min) as of latest observations

Properties.Name: Galactic group
Properties.Description: Member of what galactic grouping (ie. Milky Way and Andromeda galaxies are part of the Local Group)

Properties.Name: Classification
Properties.Description: Galaxy classification using the de Vaucouleurs-Sandage modification of the older Hubble sequence of morphological classification.

Properties.Name: Interaction
Properties.Description: Galaxies can have observable interactions ranging from colliding, cannibalism, up to the extreme of merging

Properties.Name: Stars
Properties.Description: Estimated number of stars that make up this galaxy
